activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10960
activity.text:
Hello @nihal467
I apologize for the delay in responding, as I was busy with my mid-term exams. Upon investigating the issue in depth, I’ve identified some concerns while attempting to replicate it myself. 
For Test-1:  
When creating a new location, one must be an Admin to add a new location within a facility. However, when creating a Multi-type location, I’d like to clarify your statement about keeping the location within a single test. Did you mean something like this:

- ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/72a49fae-8f42-4f73-b898-7834dddbd8f8)

- ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed1dab63-1fb5-4823-8361-dbc1fda94ba0)


Or were you referring to something different? When assigning a new location to a patient during a live encounter, the search functionality works correctly under certain conditions, such as when the child location is set to Bed.
Well looking forward for your response as with clarifications i will be able to complete the testing and make the PR soon.
Thanks

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10960
activity.text:
This looks like an interesting E2E issue, but I have a few queries regarding location creation and updates to ensure the test covers necessary scenarios:

- In Test-1, should we create all three location types (Room, Bed, House) within a single test, or would it be better to have separate tests for each type to ensure more granular validation?
- In Tes-2, What should happen if the assigned location is already occupied? Should we include error handling scenarios in the test?
Looking for the insights

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10924
activity.text:
> Hello [@rithviknishad](https://github.com/rithviknishad), There is is npm package named [i18n-unused](https://www.npmjs.com/package/i18n-unused) using this we can create a script to remove the unused keys. To prevent this in future we can add this script CI/CD integration.

I share a similar perspective, but I'm committed to integrating automated tests that verify the workflow continues to function correctly after keys are removed. These tests can include snapshot tests or runtime checks for missing translations.
